column4: Pulseaudio bug fix didn't work for me.  Sound Preferences still doesn't see my hardware.  When I select Alsa and test, I do get a beep.
if you do get a beep then it should woprk. just disregard sound prefferences
get the gnome alsa mixer out of the repository for control
The problem is that I still do not hear audio when I play files.
gotcha. did you try changing the hardware profiles?
How do I do both?
and what sound card do you have?
HDA Intel
in the Multimedia Systems Selector, change the "device" pulldown to other things listed there and test them all
Alsa and OSS both give me a beep, but Alsa allows me to select a device "ALC861".
Pulseaudio does not give me a beep.
i am sorry, i have to go get supper ready for the kids. pm me and keep me updated if you want and i can try to help more when i get back
okay.
glad to know you got it straightened out. thanks for the update :)
I finally did it.  I removed Ubuntu from my computer.  After looking at the Live CD, I think all of my problems had to do with the network upgrade.
You're welcome. I am NEVER updating over the network again.
I had better results with the LiveCD, but it still had an issue with the Dummy Audio. It did see my hardware though.
so you're not having the popping issue though?
I did not notice it with the LiveCD, but I can tell you once I have finished installing 9.10.
sounds good. gonna be afk for a bit putting the baby sto sleep so fel free to pm me results
okay.
